name: transferable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be used or legally owned by someone else: The tickets were marked "not transferable". These service plans are all fully transferable to subsequent owners. Parental leave should be transferable between partners.
that can be used in a different situation, or for a different purpose: Students gain transferable skills, the school says. Researchers will get advice on how to make their scientific work relevant and easily transferable to industry.
(of a disease) that can be passed from one person or animal to another: There are some diseases that are transferable between humans and animals.
More examplesFewer examplesPrizes are not transferable except to a surviving spouse.They are showing their support for marriage by offering a transferable personal tax allowance exclusively to married couples with young children.In some cases, workers have transferable skills. They can, for example, use computers with ease. Anthrax is not easily transferable.
